stadium.name: The Unruly Yard
stadium.description: A field in the center of the city's most rebellious district. The stadium is covered in graffiti, the crowd is hostile, and riots are a common post-game (and mid-game) event.

stats.pregame_ritual: Drinking a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.

stadium.name: The Sun-Baked Bowl
stadium.description: A simple, deep bowl dug from clay and sandstone on the edge of a caravan oasis. The heat is oppressive, and the 'stands' are just blankets laid on the sun-baked dunes.

stats.pregame_ritual: Eating a piece of honeycomb to 'sweeten' their victory.
Smelling a piece of burnt wood from a campfire.
Methodically tearing a large leaf into tiny, identical pieces.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Humming a tune they believe only they know.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Shaving one half of their mustache for important games.
Consulting a folk rhyme about the weather to predict the game's outcome.
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Methodically tearing a large leaf into tiny, identical pieces.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.

Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Smelling a piece of burnt wood from a campfire.

preGame:
Step right up, you marvelous monsters and mayhem-seekers! This is Nok the Corrupter, the voice that keeps your ears ringing and your hearts pounding, bringing you a humdinger of a Tuesday Night Trollball report! We find ourselves in the heart of rebellion at The Unruly Yard in New Monteforte. Can you smell that, folks? It's not just the graffiti-stained stone and the scent of a rowdy crowd—it's the smell of a playoff series on the line! The Desert Spectres might have a one-game lead in this Best-of-Three, but the Chaos Creatures are playing on their home turf, surrounded by unstable scaffolding and the kind of hostile fans that would make a demon blush with pride!

The atmosphere is absolutely electric! We've got the rebellious spirit of Dame Terra Monteforte's White Ravens clashing against the gritty endurance of Geth the Gravelord’s Desert Spectres. I just saw the Chaos Creatures' own Boulanger Procto meticulously arranging his gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral. A bit fancy for a man who's about to be pulverized, don't you think? Meanwhile, Urata Oriana is testing the heft of that massive Zweihander with swings so slow and deliberate they’d make a glacier look like a sprinter! And let’s not forget Gabriele Klehm, kissing the Trollball right on its stitched nose—talk about a love-hate relationship!

But don't count out the visitors! The Desert Spectres are bringing their own brand of weirdness to the Yard. Muscolo Jaehne is over in the corner methodically tearing a leaf into tiny, identical pieces—now that’s the kind of focus that wins championships, or at least causes a lot of confusion! And look at Steve! She’s already organizing a betting pool on who gets the first concussion! That's the spirit, Steve! Whether they're following the folk rhymes of Shelman McQuoid or the cold-water rituals of Huesman Ring, the Spectres are here to bury the competition under the sandstone. It’s the playoffs, folks! The loser faces the bracket of shame, and the winner moves one step closer to eternal glory in Osterra! Let the carnage begin!
postGame:
What a glorious, blood-soaked spectacle we just witnessed here at The Unruly Yard! I’ve seen some scrap-heaps in my time, but this game was a genuine masterpiece of fantasy violence! The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures have roared back to life, snatching a 3-2 victory in a game that went the distance and then some! The series is tied, folks! We’re heading to a Game 3, and my horns are tingling with the sheer anticipation of it!

The match started with a bang as Raouf Dragone snatched up the Trollball like a hungry scavenger. The Chaos Creatures were playing with a fire under their britches, culminating in a magnificent shot from Gabriele Klehm that put them up by two early on! It was a beautiful sight, seeing that troll head soar through the air while the crowd screamed for blood! The White Ravens really showed up today, though I’m sure Dame Terra Monteforte would have preferred a few more broken bones in those opening minutes.

But the Spectres weren't about to roll over in the New Monteforte mud! Steve, that absolute powerhouse, decided to remind everyone why she’s a fan favorite by leveling Placido Kora with a tackle that likely rattled teeth in the next reality! Shortly after, she intercepted a wild pass from Fogel Raynold, turning the tide with the grace of a charging rhino. The momentum shifted like a sandstorm when Eileen Mikihisa launched a 2-point shot from the Home zone, knotting the score and sending us into a frantic, heart-stopping Overtime!

Overtime was where the real beauty of Trollball shone through! It was a revolving door at the healer's tent, with players being carried off and stitched back together faster than you can say 'regeneration loss.' Lovash Marius was a one-demon wrecking crew, injuring Alben Diantha and Placido Kora in quick succession. I haven't seen that much armor-clanging since Artorias tried to find his keys! It was a symphony of destruction that would make any demon's heart skip a beat!

The injury list grew longer than a warlock's scroll. Steve continued her rampage, taking out Urata Oriana, while Gabriele Klehm found herself on the receiving end of a Shelman McQuoid tackle. It reached a point where we almost had too few players to continue! Can you believe it? The referee was looking around like a lost soul in a library! That is exactly the kind of 'heroic' effort I love to see—players so dedicated to the game they literally cannot stand up anymore!

I have to throw some shade at the so-called 'heroes' of the realm. While Sir Tanos and his bunch are out there worrying about 'saving' things, these athletes are out here doing the real work of breaking them! The Desert Spectres’ Fidellia Mozelle was putting in work until Fogel Raynold decided she needed a nap, sending her to the sidelines with a crunch that echoed off the graffiti-covered walls. The Chaos Creatures were playing like they had an open bar waiting for them, fueled by nothing but spite and Lian Denton’s hot gravy!

As the clock ticked on, the desperation was palpable. We saw wild passes, dropped balls, and enough missed shots to fill a stadium! Alben Diantha and Eileen Mikihisa were throwing the Trollball like it was a hot coal. It was a chaotic scramble that would have made Cyfnerth the Butcher proud! The tension was so thick you could cut it with a Bardiche, and the hostile crowd was practically foaming at the mouth!

Then came the moment of truth! Amidst the scramble in the Home zone, the ball was dropped, fumbled, and finally snatched up by Raouf Dragone. But it was Mouldon Earl who found the opening! With the defense reeling and the Spectres gasping for air, Earl charged into the End Zone and dunked that troll head for the game-winning point! The Unruly Yard absolutely erupted! I haven't heard a roar like that since Morgwae accidentally set fire to the arcanist's library!

This victory means the Chaos Creatures have forced a Game 3! They’ve proven that the 'Heroes' of the White Ravens aren't just for show—they can take a beating and give it back double! The Desert Spectres looked a bit sun-dazed toward the end, perhaps missing the oppressive heat of their own bowl. They’ll need to find their desert grit again if they want to avoid the loser’s bracket. Geth the Gravelord won’t be happy about this one, not one bit!

Final Score: The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures 3, The Desert Spectres 2! What a day for the history books, or at least the ones Cinnemon hasn't cursed yet! We’ve got ourselves a series, sports fans! Make sure your affairs are in order and your weapons are sharpened, because the deciding match is going to be a total slaughter! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off! Stay violent, Osterra!
